Exoneration.definition: the act of disburdening or discharging

1.definition: the act of disburdening or discharging (as from a charge, liability, obligation, duty, or responsibility)the state of being so freed

2 a.definition: the right of a person who has paid a debt for which he or she is only secondarily liable to be reimbursed by the person primarily liable

sub_terms.b: the right of a surety to require a person or estate that is subject to a liability for which the surety is secondarily liable to discharge the liability thus relieving the suretythe equitable remedy by which the surety compels discharge of the liability
